title.narrative: Accountability and Fulfilment for Older Persons (AFFORD) - phase II

description.narrative: Civil Societies and their networks, communities in target countries (excluding Ireland), demonstrate more supportive attitudes and actions to promote the voice of older men and women in attainment of their rights and entitlements.
National social and health protection policies, public governance systems and structures at all levels are more responsive and accountable to older women and men's rights and needs
Older women and men in the targeted countries, including the most marginalised, benefit from increased access to nationally appropriate, inclusive and effective social protection systems.
Societies, communities, individuals in Ireland, demonstrate more supportive attitudes and actions towards older women and men in the targeted countries and the wider Global South.

The goal for the programme is that by the end of 2021, older women and men in the targeted countries (Ethiopia, Malawi, Mozambique and Tanzania) lead more dignified, secure and resilient lives. This is in line with HelpAge's vision and mission statement (Strategy 2020), and would contribute to furthering the realisation of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) on poverty eradication (SDG#1), gender equality (#5), reduction of inequalities (#10) and inclusion and accountability (#16).
